channel.title: Categories on Listwon
channel.description: Recent content in Categories on Listwon

item.title: git clean -xdf and friends
item.description:
Remove all untracked files and directories recursively:

git clean -xdf

Fetch all Git LFS content for your repository:

git lfs fetch --all

Run as if git was started in <path> instead of the current working directory:

git -C <path>

References:

  • https://git-scm.com/docs/git
  • https://git-scm.com/docs/git-clean
  • https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorials/git-lfs

item.title: tar xfz and friends
item.description:
Extract a gzipped tar archive ( *.tar.gz ):

tar xfz archive_name.tar.gz

Extract a tar archive (*.tar):

tar xf archive_name.tar.gz

Create an uncompressed tar archive:

tar cf archive_name.tar dirname/

Create a gzipped tar archive:

tar czf archive_name.tar.gz dirname/

More examples: https://www.thegeekstuff.com/2010/04/unix-tar-command-examples/

item.title: Moving to Hugo
item.description:
Hugo just joined the list of static site generators I’ve ever used for blogging, right after Hexo and Jekyll. Unlike its predecessors it’s a single binary written in a compiled language (Go). No dependencies, less bloat.

Live preview while modifying content:

hugo server -D

-D, --buildDrafts - include content marked as draft

Build static pages:

hugo

Output will be in ./public/ directory by default

item.title: A new beginning
item.description:
In January this year, I founded the first company in my life - Pineapple Works. It’s special to me on multiple levels. First of all, because I’m working in the game industry, something I dreamed of for a long time and something that I really started doing in previous incarnation of Pineapple Works, before I became its co-owner. Secondly, I was invited to co-found it with my previous employer, which means a lot. Lastly, I’ve got my own business, own brand we are forging together to be more recognizable. It’s truly a roller coaster - stressful, but fun and satisfying.

Three months later we are publishing our third game on Nintendo Switch (fourth released Switch port in total) and at the same time we are working on some new releases. So, I’m getting excited to see what the future holds.
